dict.string: This sample demonstrates and allows user change view mode for calendar control.
This sample show the support for appointment and events for specific date and time
This sample consists of user restricted dates with a cross mark at every black out dates
This sample show the support for localization available with calendar control
This sample has customized views and allows to check various customizations available with calendar
Schedule control allows to view the days in multiple views such as day , week, work week and month view
Schedule control provides support to add and manage recursive appointments
Schedule control allows localization support to required culture.
Schedule control allows customizable view for month cell, appointments, timslots and header.
Schedule control allows to configure various properties available in the views, it also supports non-accesble blocks
QR Code is a two dimensional symbology that is popularly used in automotive industry.
DataMatrix symbology is widely used in printed media such as labels and letters.
Codabar is a discrete numeric symbology that is used in libraries and information processing applications.
Code11 Symbology is used mainly for labeling the telecommunications equipment.
Upc Barcode is mainly used for coding pharmaceuticals, cosmetics and dietetics.
Code32 is mainly used for coding pharmaceuticals, cosmetics and dietetics.
Code39 is a Symbology of Barcode that encodes alphanumeric characters into a series of bars.
Code39 Extended Symbology is an extended version of Code39 that supports full ASCII character set.
Code93 represents the full ASCII character set by using the combination of 2 characters.
Code93 is designed to complement and improve upon Code 39.
Code128A includes all the standard upper case alphanumeric characters, punctuation, and special characters.
Code128B includes all the standard upper & lower case alphanumeric characters, punctuation and special characters.
Code128C includes a set of 100 digit pairs from 00 to 99 inclusive, as well as three special characters.
This sample showcases the SfDataGrid with ObservableCollection as the data source..
This sample showcases the sorting capabilities of data in SfDataGrid that allows you to sort against one or more columns and also provides Tri-state sorting functionality.
This sample showcases the filtering capabilities of data in SfDataGrid.
This sample showcases the freeze panes capability of SfDataGrid which provides support to freeze rows at the top and columns at the left.
This sample showcases the grouping capability of data in SfDataGrid.
This sample showcases the selection capability of SfDataGrid which provides selection mode options like Single, Multiple, SingleDeselect and None.
This sample showcases the editing capabilities of SfDataGrid which provides support to edit GridTextColumn, GridNumericColumn, GridPickerColumn and GridDatTimeColumn.
This sample showcases the columns capability of SfDataGrid which provides support for text and UserCellType columns.
This sample showcases the column and row drag and drop capabilities of SfDataGrid which provide user flexibility when interacting with the grid rows and grid columns.
This sample showcases the unbound column capability of SfDataGrid. Unbound columns are extra columns that do not belong to the data source.
This sample showcases the styling capabilities of SfDataGrid. Styling allows you to change the visual appearance of the SfDataGrid and its inner elements.
This sample showcases the auto row height feature of SfDataGrid which renders grid rows based on its content to improve the readability and occurs on-demand basis.
This sample showcases the load more capability of SfDataGrid that allows you to load a subset of data to the bound data source using built-in UI.
This sample showcases the pull-to-refresh capability of SfDataGrid which allows you to refresh the data source upon pull-to-refresh action.
This sample showcases the paging capabilities of SfDataGrid using SfDataPager which allows you to load the data from the data source in an efficient way.
This sample showcases the swiping capabilities of SfDataGrid which allow you to load swipe views and associate them with custom actions.
This sample illustrates the frequent updates that occur in random cells across the Grid while keeping processor usage to a minimum in the SfDataGrid.
This sample showcases the incremental loading capability of SfDataGrid in which a subset of data is fetched from the services in runtime when needed.
This sample showcases the excel and pdf exporting capabilities of SfDataGrid. SfDataGrid also provides you various customization options for exporting.

This sample illustrates the performance of SfChart in real time update scenario
Annotations used to display metadata about a chart or series at a specific point of interest in the plotting area
Axis Crossing feature changes the location at which the x-axis crosses the y-axis and vice versa
This sample showcases the use of category axis in chart. Category axis is an indexed based axis that plots values based on its index in the data source.
This sample showcases the use of date time axis
This sample showcases the use of numerical axis in chart. Numerical axis is used to plot numeric values.
This sample showcases the use of logarithmic axis in chart.
Strip lines are used to highlight specific range in the chart. They can be horizontal or vertical, and also be made to optionally repeat at specific intervals.
This sample showcases the use of multiple axes in chart.
This sample showcases the trackball feature. Trackball displays the tooltip for the data points that are closer to the point where you touch on the chart area.
Selection allows you to highlight a data point. You can select a data point by tapping on it.
This sample showcases the zooming and panning capabilities of chart
This sample showcases vertical charts feature.
This sample showcases tooltip capabilities in chart. Tooltip feature is used to show information about the segment, when you tap on the segment.
This sample showcases the customization of data markers. Data markers are used to provide information about the data points to the user.
This sample demonstrates the automatic scrolling of axis during real time updates.
Technical indicators are the base for technical analysis, which is used to determine the future of financial, stock or economic trends.
This sample demonstrates how to create a PowerPoint presentation by adding text with simple text formatting.
This sample demonstrates how to create a slide with predefined layouts, like Microsoft PowerPoint.
This sample demonstrates how to add an image in PowerPoint presentation.
This sample demonstrates how to create a table with specified number of rows and columns in PowerPoint presentation for displaying tabular data.
This sample demonstrates how to create a pie chart in PowerPoint presentation.
This sample demonstrates how to add comments in PowerPoint presentation for reviewing and updating feedbacks.
XlsIO supports to create an Excel document without any dependency of Microsoft Excel in few lines of code.
Create and manipulate all types of Excel charts with elements like chart title, legend, axis title, data labels, line styles, etc.
XlsIO has support to read, write and calculate formulas. The built-in calculation engine can quickly evaluate formula cell values at runtime.
Business objects usually holds a set of instance variables or properties, also known as attributes. XlsIO allows to import data directly from business objects.
XlsIO supports single line of code to import XML data into an Excel worksheet.
XlsIO supports data filtering based on text, date and custom options.
XlsIO supports to find the range of a value in the worksheet and replace it with a new value.
This sample demonstrates how to create simple Word document with text, images and tables.
This sample demonstrates how to format the Word document contents with the built-in styles.
This sample demonstrates how to format the Word document contents with user defined styles.
This sample demonstrates how to insert, retrieve, replace and delete the contents of a specified bookmark using BookmarkNavigator functionality of DocIO.
This sample demonstrates how to create a letter format document by filling the data using Mail merge functionality of DocIO.
This sample demonstrates how to fill data and protect the content controls in an existing Word document.
This sample demonstrates how to map custom XML part to content controls in the Word document.
This sample demonstrates how to convert a Word document into HTML file.
This sample demonstrates how to create a simple PDF document with text and images.
This sample demonstrates how to create various barcodes on PDF document.
This sample demonstrates how to stamp or watermark an existing PDF document.
This sample demonstrates how to create a booklet from an existing PDF document.
This sample demonstrates how to create borderless table in a PDF document.
This sample demonstrates how to insert images in a PDF document.
This sample demonstrates how to digitally sign PDF document using a .pfx certificate.
This sample demonstrates how to create secure PDF document.
This sample demonstrates how to view the PDF document in Xamarin iOS application.
This sample demonstrates the Organization layout of Diagram.
This sample demonstrates creating a simple flow diagram using Diagram Control.
This sample demonstrates the Customization of the Node.
